intro: Boscheria, commonly known as the orchid vine, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their climbing habit and showy, often fragrant flowers. They typically have long, slender stems and are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Boscheria species are known for their ability to thrive in humid environments and their preference for well-drained soil. The flowers often feature intricate patterns and come in a variety of colors, making them popular in horticulture.
